tldr: The study examines the ultrastructure of the periderm in a species of Monograptus (Phylum Hemichordata). The longitudinal strengthening rods are identified as high, sharp ridges, supported by low-angled buttresses. The periderm ultrastructure consists of a dense network of short rods. The research provides insights into the skeletal structure and secretion process of the graptolite zooid.
